title: 109_s3762
content: The Act may be cited as the "Fossil Creek Wild and Scenic River Act of 2005". Congress acknowledges the remarkable restoration of stream flow to Fossil Creek, resulting in the rebirth of a river. The spring-fed waters and unique geological formations of Fossil Creek are exceptional. The restoration will benefit native wildlife and the Yavapai-Apache Nation considers the area sacred. Fossil Creek flows into the Verde River, a National Wild and Scenic River. The Northern Arizona University has invested resources in studying the restoration of Fossil Creek and its unique characteristics. State and Federal agencies have also invested in restoring native fish populations. The Fossil Creek watershed offers various recreational activities. The Forest Service has determined Fossil Creek's eligibility for inclusion in the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. The Fossil Creek area, known for its remarkable geology, ecology, and wildlife, deserves long-term protection through a sustainable management plan. The Wild and Scenic Rivers Act is amended to designate Fossil Creek in Arizona as a wild and scenic river, with specific segments identified for protection. The Secretary of Agriculture will manage designated river segments and submit a management plan to Congress within 2 years. An allowance for restoration activities is also included. SEC. 5. ALLOWANCE FOR RESTORATION ACTIVITIES. Arizona Public Service Company may conduct project decommissioning and restoration activities for the Childs-Irving Hydroelectric Project. Federal and State agencies can also conduct stream restoration activities for the Fossil Creek Native Fish Restoration Project. SEC. 6. STREAM MONITORING. SEC. 6. STREAM MONITORING. The United States Geological Survey or Forest Service permittees can install stream flow gauges on Fossil Creek to monitor water resources. SEC. 7. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. SEC. 7. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Funds are authorized for management plans for designated river segments, a river ranger for Fossil Creek, and other Act-related activities.
